content.prompt: Which of the following best explains a change in United States foreign policy in the years immediately after the end of the Cold War?

choices.label: The United States sought to aid other nations struggling against communism.
The United States established an international financial system to aid countries devastated by war.
The United States engaged in new sorts of military and peacekeeping interventions in several countries.
The United States sought to acquire new territories outside of its existing boundaries.

topic.text: 9.3: The End of the Cold War

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
